message: Is there something like ActiveState's cookbook for Fabric recipes? I would like to see a few example scripts.
Though I'd like to focus on one more feature release of the project itself before those latter two items :)

That said, the state of Fabric's websites is in flux right now (moving code.fabfile to Github, replacing it with a lightweight set of redirects, and hopefully setting up a blog/non-doc website soon too) so it's certainly possible a cookbook site could arise out of the chaos.

Not at this time, but we've kinda-sorta wanted one for a while, see http://code.fabfile.org/issues/show/99 . Sadly it's not been a high priority over working on Fabric itself, partly because there don't seem to be any good OOB solutions so there'd be at least some hacking involved.
I have a little bit of code to make it possible to use Solaris' "priv" instead of "sudo" ... took me a while to figure it out, and it'd be good to put somewhere useful...
